description.narrative: VESTA received pre-core support from Sida based on an action plan for implementing the recommendations of the System Based Audit (SBA). Apart from financial support, the Embassy has provided training and coaching through Swedish Development Advisers (SDA) on different subject matters. Besides this, Vesta has planned its own set of capacity building activities that aimed at better understanding and drafting strategic documents. The SBA of VESTA that was carried out in September 2018 and served as a basis for pre-core support, provided 30 recommendations of which 16 were highlighted as priority recommendations. These priority recommendations were grouped as follows: - Strategy development and results-based management (six recommendations), - Risk management (two recommendations), - Management of operations (three recommendations), - Financial management and control (two recommendations), - Auditing (three recommendations).

Vesta is one of the few organisations working to promote gender equality and women’s empowerment, and to combat domestic violence in Gagauzia territorial autonomous unit of Moldova. The pre-core support granted for organisation is a simplified contribution which aims at supporting the organization to develop its internal capacities and policies.
During pre-core support phase Vesta will implement priority recommendations provided by the Nordic Consulting Group in the system-based audit report produced in 2018. Therefore, it will develop institutional capacities, internal routines, staff knowledge and skills to be able to implement core-support activities. Based on a follow-up report on pre-core activities to be conducted tentatively in December 2019, Sida may consider continuing with core-support with Vesta organisation based on the Strategic Plan, RAF and strategic budget developed during pre-core support.
The intervention total budget is 323 328 SEK.

Vesta är en av de få organisationerna i landet som arbetar med jämlikhet, kvinnors rättigheter samt för att motverka våld i hemmet i Gagauzien. (Gagauzien är en region i Moldavien som åtnjuter viss självständighet). Syftet med det förberedande kärnstödet är att stärka organisationens kapacitet och utveckla deras interna regelverk.
Vesta kommer under denna första fas av stödet (innan kärnstöd) att genomföra de prioriterade rekommendationerna från Nordic Consulting Group presenterade i den systembaserade revisionsrapporten som gjordes 2018. Vesta utvecklar institutionell kapacitet, interna rutiner, personalkunskaper och andra färdigheter för att kunna genomföra kärnstödsaktiviteter. Baserat på en kommande uppföljningsrapport som avser aktiviteter under denna första fas (rapport tas preliminärt fram i december 2019) kan Sida sedan överväga att fortsätta med kärnstöd till Vesta baserat på en strategisk plan, resultatram och den strategiska budgeten som utvecklats inför kärnstödet.
Insatsens totala budget uppgår till 323 328 SEK.

participating-org.narrative: VESTA/A.O. Asociatia Regionala A Mamelor Cu Multi Copii Si A Femeilor Interprinzator Din Gagauzia

sector.narrative: Women’s rights organisations and movements, and government institutions

tag.narrative: 5.2 - Avskaffa alla former av våld mot alla kvinnor och flickor i det offentliga och privata rummet, inklusive människohandel, sexuellt utnyttjande och andra typer av exploatering.
5.2 - Eliminate all forms of violence against all women and girls in the public and private spheres, including trafficking and sexual and other types of exploitation.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: VESTA can be said to have implemented most of priority recommendations related to strategy development and RBM. Most importantly a new Strategic Plan has been developed and adopted, along with a fully adequate RAF. In line with the SBA recommendation, VESTA has developed an M&E Policy. It includes some of the basic elements that are normally included in an M&E policy but, in the absence of a plan and templates, it is not clear how it will be implemented and to what extent it will support the RAF. VESTA’s new Communication Policy and Communication Plan are more specific in nature, save for the lack of clear communication messages. The two priority recommendations that have not been implemented are: prioritising staffing needs and costs in the strategy process; and setting up a system for monitoring the implementation of its Strategic Plan. It was noted that VESTA has created some new positions and made other staff changes, which generally appear to be justified. The hiring of a new Executive Director and the appointment of the former as the Chairperson of the Board could potentially promote organisational sustainability.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
